intro: Thlaspi revellieri, commonly known as the alpine rock cress, is a flowering plant native to alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. This species is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Thlaspi revellieri is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous environments.
